section.para: In the runtime system, values consist of two parts: an array of pointers and an auxiliary part. The size of each part is included in the value.

section.title: Lambdas
section.para: The array of pointers of a lambda stores the captured values of the lambda. The auxiliary part of a lambda stores a function pointer to the implementation of the lambda.

The implementation of a lambda receives the lambda itself, not just the argument. This allows the lambda to access its captured values. The implementation of a lambda has the following signature:
graRtsValue *graRtsLambdaCode graRtsHeap *heap graRtsValue *lambda graRtsValue *argument
